data.title: Power Metal!
data.meta_description: First post ever on here,  any power metal fans out there?  What do you like about it?  Any band suggestions? I had a huge realization that Power Metal is...

#1

First post ever on here, any power metal fans out there? What do you like about it? Any band suggestions? I had a huge realization that Power Metal is where its at for me, I love all sorts of music and I love metal but power metal gives me the feels! One of the few genres of music that I get pumped and seriously all sorts of emotions pour out of me whenever I here some avantasia or rhapsody. Anyways does anyone else get like that? Or is it just me?

This site may earn a commission from merchant links like Ebay, Amazon, and others.

Tad Morose are great, check out their albums ''Undead'',''Matters of the dark'' and ''Modus Vivendi''.

#3

Thanks, ill check that out. I really wanna discover more power metal bands. I really love Blind Guardian, rhapsody of fire, Avantasia, Edguy. A lot of just big name bands, I know there are a lot of sweet gems out there. My friend went to Wales and he got me a copy of a Steel Wing album and those guys are great, they are a perfect mix of Judas priest and iron maiden.

Is spiral architect or twisted into form considered power metal? I like them and control denied. Never could get into the dungeons and dragon element a lot of the bands have though. I always think of dio walking around with that sword in holy diver and can't take it seriously.

Haha I know what you mean, for awhile I was a bit thrown off about the fantasy style of power metal, but now I love it, I love all of it. "Ghost love score" by Nightwish is amazing, especially the live version. That opera/choir style in power metal is probably one of my favorite aspects of the genre.

Not really into that many bands in this genre but I'll throw in a second vote for Lost horizon and also add Blind Guardian (Nightfall in Middle Earth, A night at the opera and Imaginations from the other side are all fantastic albums from their discography).

Also, Kamelot's "The black halo" is pretty awesome. Though I never got into any of their other material.

Sonata Arctica! I haven't listened to them in forever. What happened to Jani? Is he still playing with a band?

He's a blogger.

Jani hates you all

I think he's working on Sydanpuu, his short lived side project from years back(he revived it). Prior to that, he released an acoustic album with Timo from Stratovarius. Additionally, he helped out with the latest Stratovarius album Nemesis.

He also hinted at a new Cain's Offering(short lived power metal supergroup from a few years ago) album, but not set in stone or anytime soon.

#17

Is spiral architect or twisted into form considered power metal?

NO! They are not. Those bands are both technical progressive metal bands. Totally different in terms of composition and atmosphere. These are legit good bands.

I used to be able to listen to power metal when I was a teenager, but not so much nowadays.

I always like Helloween and Rhapsody. From Helloween I'd recommend Keeper Of The Seven Keys pt II for their old style, and Rabbit Don't Come Easy for their newer style.

For Rhapsody I'd recommend Dawn Of Victory.

Of course there's good ol' Dragonforce as well. I only ever liked their 2nd album.

Also the band Time Requiem is alright, but half the time it's just ridiculously way too fast noodle solos.
